text:
Hi
You guys have probably come across this previously, but we are having the root (non-www) domain to www subdomain issue with a few of our clients. What IP would we point the A record to for the non-www domain to go to the www of the domain? The clients DNS does not support redirect.
HS is setup on the www of the domain for each of these clients

Hey. Just wondered if anyone else is experiencing some issues while editing and publishing pages. Changes are not being pulled through and when they do it is taking some time. I noticed this was happening yesterday on the service status. Just making sure it's not just me.
Is there a way to report to HubSpot more officially when you notice technical issues anyone?
i would say the official way is via support ticket
Hey Jim, is this happening today (the changes not being pulled in) or is this in reference to what happened yesterday?
Hey. I am experiencing it today.
It is being glitchy while pulling in stylesheet changes and also changes made to the drag and drop area.
Ill loop in with folks on our end and see what I can find out
It does correct itself after a while but it's taking some time. Hopefully that helps.
We had a short period this morning where updates for some customers were delayed. This is fixed now and there was no loss of data.
We seem to be still experiencing it unfortunately.
I am seeing a warning in the console such as - DevTools failed to parse SourceMap: <https://app.HubSpot.com/content/editor/prefetcher.js.map>
I accidentally deleted the post directly above mine, sincerely sorry about that. I can’t restore it.

Just to kind of clear things up.

If you experience a non-developer specific issue and its negatively impacting a portal. Support is your best bet.
<https://help.HubSpot.com/>

If your question or issue does appear to be developer specific. Posting it on this slack or the community forums may get you help from the community. It also may help you find others experiencing the same issue, and enable HubSpotter’s to more quickly troubleshoot.

HubSpotter’s do hang around here, but it is not guaranteed that one will respond.

If HubSpot functionality appears to legitimately be having an issue and it’s impacting your portal or work, contact support.

If your issue appears to be a pretty significant,  please check our status page <https://status.HubSpot.com/>
If lots of portals are experiencing the issue, we provide regular updates there to let you know the resolution progress.

If the issue is related to a developer beta, go to the beta’s slack channel and post about it there. The developers working on that functionality hangout in those channels and you will be directly helping them improve HubSpot.
